alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 11:50AM EDT until March 31 at 8:27PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River. Mill Creek near Cataract. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Significant rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches last week has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with several smaller tributaries. Moderate flooding is occurring on a small portion of the East Fork White River, and is expected to develop in the coming days on the lower reaches of the White and Wabash Rivers. Water continues to rise in many locations. The crests on the main stem rivers are in the following locations currently. On the Wabash, upstream of Lafayette. On the White, near or just south of Centerton, and along the East Fork White, between Shelbyville and Columbus. Most smaller tributaries are past crest and falling. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas, particularly in southwest Indiana along the lower reaches of the main stem rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Elliston. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Shawnee Airfield floods as flood waters begin to get into the hangar. Relocation of livestock may be necessary. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will rise to 25.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning to 13.7 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 14.2 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 11 PM EDT this evening.
